entity.name: Jotai
entity.description: A state management solution that takes an atomic approach to global React state management. Build state by combining atoms and renders are automatically optimized based on atom dependency.
entity.descriptionClean: A state management solution that takes an atomic approach to global React state management. Build state by combining atoms and renders are automatically optimized based on atom dependency.

example.codeHighlighted: const valueAtom = atom(0) function Counter() { const [value, setValue] = useAtom(animeAtom) const increment = setValue((v) => v + 1) // ... }

entity.name: Legend State
entity.description: A state management solution that provides extremely fast signal-based state with fine-grained reactivity and a powerful sync system that works with any backend.
entity.descriptionClean: A state management solution that provides extremely fast signal-based state with fine-grained reactivity and a powerful sync system that works with any backend.

example.codeHighlighted: const counter = observable({ value: 0 }) const Counter = observer(() => { const value = counter.value.use() const increment = () => counter.value.set((v) => v + 1) // ... })

entity.name: MobX
entity.description: A signal-based state management library that makes state management simple and scalable by transparently applying functional reactive programming.
entity.descriptionClean: A signal-based state management library that makes state management simple and scalable by transparently applying functional reactive programming.

example.codeHighlighted: const counter = observable({ value: 0 }) const Counter = observer(() => { const value = counter.value const increment = () => counter.value++ // ... })

entity.name: MobX State Tree
entity.description: A state container system built on top of MobX. MobX is a state management "engine", and MobX-State-Tree gives it structure and common tools you need for your app.
entity.descriptionClean: A state container system built on top of MobX. MobX is a state management "engine", and MobX-State-Tree gives it structure and common tools you need for your app.
entity.descriptionHtml: A state container system built on top of MobX. MobX is a state management "engine", and MobX-State-Tree gives it structure and common tools you need for your app.

example.codeHighlighted: const model = t .model('counter', { value: t.number }) .actions((self) => ({ increment() { self.value++ })) const counter = model.create({ value: 0 }) function Counter() { const value = counter.value const increment = counter.increment // ... }

entity.name: React built-ins
entity.description: The most basic primitives for "remembering" the state of the React component.
entity.descriptionClean: The most basic primitives for "remembering" the state of the React component.
entity.descriptionHtml: The most basic primitives for "remembering" the state of the React component.

example.codeHighlighted: function Counter() { const [value, setValue] = useState(0) const increment = () => setValue((v) => v + 1) // ... }

entity.name: Recoil
entity.description: An experimental state management library that lets you create a data-flow graph that flows from atoms (shared state) through selectors (pure functions) and down into your React components.
entity.descriptionClean: An experimental state management library that lets you create a data-flow graph that flows from atoms (shared state) through selectors (pure functions) and down into your React components.

example.codeHighlighted: const state = atom({ key: 'counter', default: 0 }) function Counter() { const [value, setValue] = useRecoilState(state) const increment = () => setValue(v => v + 1) // ... }

entity.name: Redux
entity.description: A predictable state container based on unidirectional data flow and immutable state updates.
entity.descriptionClean: A predictable state container based on unidirectional data flow and immutable state updates.

example.codeHighlighted: function reducer(state = { value: 0 }, action) { switch (action.type) { case 'increment': return { value: state.value + 1 } default: return state } } const store = createStore(reducer) function Counter() { const value = useSelector((state) => state.value) const dispatch = useDispatch() const increment = dispatch({ type: 'increment' }) // ... }

entity.name: Redux Toolkit
entity.description: The official, opinionated, batteries-included toolset for efficient Redux development.
entity.descriptionClean: The official, opinionated, batteries-included toolset for efficient Redux development.

example.codeHighlighted: const slice = createSlice({ name: 'counter', initialState: { value: 0 }, reducers: { increment: (state) => { state.value++ }, }, }) const store = configureStore({ reducer: slice.reducer }) function Counter() { const value = useSelector((state) => state.value) const dispatch = useDispatch() const increment = () => dispatch(counterSlice.actions.increment()) // ... }

entity.name: XState
entity.description: A powerful and flexible way to manage application and workflow state by allowing developers to model logic as actors and state machines.
entity.descriptionClean: A powerful and flexible way to manage application and workflow state by allowing developers to model logic as actors and state machines.

example.codeHighlighted: const machine = createMachine({ initial: 'active', context: { value: 0, }, states: { active: { on: { INCREMENT: { actions: assign({ value: (context) => context.value + 1 }) } } } } } }) function Counter() { const [snapshot, send] = useMachine(machine) const value = snapshot.context.value const increment = () => send('INCREMENT') // ... }

entity.name: Zustand
entity.description: A small, fast, and scalable bearbones state management solution that isn't boilerplatey or opinionated, but has enough convention to be explicit and flux-like.
entity.descriptionClean: A small, fast, and scalable bearbones state management solution that isn't boilerplatey or opinionated, but has enough convention to be explicit and flux-like.
entity.descriptionHtml: A small, fast, and scalable bearbones state management solution that isn't boilerplatey or opinionated, but has enough convention to be explicit and flux-like.

example.codeHighlighted: const useStore = create((set) => ({ count: 0, increment: () => set((state) => ({ count: state.count + 1 })), })) function Counter() { const { count, increment } = useStore() // ... }

entity.name: Apollo Client
entity.description: A library enabling managing both local and remote data with GraphQL. Used for fetching, caching, and modifying application data, all while automatically updating the app's UI.
entity.descriptionClean: A library enabling managing both local and remote data with GraphQL. Used for fetching, caching, and modifying application data, all while automatically updating the app's UI.
entity.descriptionHtml: A library enabling managing both local and remote data with GraphQL. Used for fetching, caching, and modifying application data, all while automatically updating the app's UI.

example.codeHighlighted: const client = new ApolloClient({ uri, cache }) const query = gql` query Example { // ... } ` function Component() { const { loading, error, data } = useQuery(query) // ... }

entity.name: Axios
entity.description: Promise based HTTP client based on XMLHttpRequests.
entity.descriptionClean: Promise based HTTP client based on XMLHttpRequests.

example.code: const response = await axios.get(url)
example.codeHighlighted: const response = await axios.get(url)

entity.name: Fetch API
entity.description: An interface for fetching resources.
entity.descriptionClean: An interface for fetching resources.

example.code: const response = await fetch(url)
example.codeHighlighted: const response = await fetch(url)

entity.name: Relay
entity.description: The GraphQL client that scales with you. A framework for building data-driven React applications.
entity.descriptionClean: The GraphQL client that scales with you. A framework for building data-driven React applications.

example.codeHighlighted: const query = graphql` query Example { // ... } ` function Component() { const data = useLazyLoadQuery(query) // ... }

entity.name: RTK Query
entity.description: A powerful data fetching and caching tool. It is designed to simplify common cases for loading data in an application, eliminating the need to hand-write data fetching & caching logic yourself.
entity.descriptionClean: A powerful data fetching and caching tool. It is designed to simplify common cases for loading data in an application, eliminating the need to hand-write data fetching  caching logic yourself.
entity.descriptionHtml: A powerful data fetching and caching tool. It is designed to simplify common cases for loading data in an application, eliminating the need to hand-write data fetching & caching logic yourself.

example.codeHighlighted: const exampleApi = createApi({ baseQuery: fetchBaseQuery({ baseUrl }), endpoints: (builder) => ({ exampleQuery: builder.query({ query: () => `examplePath` }) }), // ... }) const store = configureStore({ reducer: { [exampleApi.reducerPath]: exampleApi.reducer }, // ... }) function Component() { const { data, error, isLoading } = exampleApi.useExampleQuery() // ... }

entity.name: SWR
entity.description: React Hooks for Data Fetching. A strategy to first return the data from cache (stale), then send the fetch request (revalidate), and finally come with the up-to-date data.
entity.descriptionClean: React Hooks for Data Fetching. A strategy to first return the data from cache (stale), then send the fetch request (revalidate), and finally come with the up-to-date data.

example.codeHighlighted: function Component() { const { data, error, isLoading } = useSWR(url, fetcher) // ... }

entity.name: TanStack Query
entity.description: (former React Query) A data-fetching library that makes fetching, caching, synchronizing and updating server state in the application a breeze.
entity.descriptionClean: (former React Query) A data-fetching library that makes fetching, caching, synchronizing and updating server state in the application a breeze.

example.codeHighlighted: const queryClient = new QueryClient() function Component() { const { isPending, error, data } = useQuery({ queryKey: ['example'], queryFn }) // ... }

entity.name: tRPC
entity.description: A solution that allows you to easily build & consume fully typesafe APIs without schemas or code generation.
entity.descriptionClean: A solution that allows you to easily build  consume fully typesafe APIs without schemas or code generation.
entity.descriptionHtml: A solution that allows you to easily build & consume fully typesafe APIs without schemas or code generation.

entity.name: react-native-unistyles
entity.description: A cross-platform library that enables you to share up to 100% of your styles across all platforms. It combines the simplicity of StyleSheet with the performance of C++.
entity.descriptionClean: A cross-platform library that enables you to share up to 100% of your styles across all platforms. It combines the simplicity of StyleSheet with the performance of C++.

entity.name: React Strict DOM

entity.name: styled components
